comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Inez Milholland Boissevain (August 6, 1886 – November 25, 1916) was a suffragist, labor lawyer, World War I correspondent, and public speaker who greatly influenced the women's movement in America." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inez_Milholland She was on Henry Ford's Peace ship Oscar II, which left Hoboken on December 5, 1915 The New York Times, January 3, 1916 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peace_Ship

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59:  Thanks for the additional information here.  We'll include some of it next time we update the description.
